p: The ABTS assay was performed by bleaching the cationic radical ABTS •+ as described by Soto et al. [ 48]. For the preparation of the radical ABTS •+, 2.5 mL of the 7 mM ABTS solution was mixed with 2.5 mL of 2.45 μM sodium persulfate for 12 h in the dark at 4 °C. Then, the resulting solution was diluted with absolute ethanol until an initial absorbance of approximately 0.70 ± 0.03 was obtained at 734 nm. The radical discoloration was initiated by adding 50 µL of the extract to 150 µL of the ABTS •+ solution. After 15 min of incubation at 25 °C, the absorbance was measured at 734 nm and compared with a calibration curve using Trolox as standard and ethanol as blank. Results were expressed as millimoles of Trolox equivalents per gram of dry sample (mmol TE/g).
